title: This what happens when you consume Khajoor with warm milk in winters - The Times of India
summary:
Health Benefits of Consuming Dates with Warm Milk in Winter

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Health & Nutrition Journal

During harsh winters, combining dates with warm milk is believed to boost immunity and overall health. This combination offers several health benefits for an energetic, comforting winter experience.

  • Strengthens Immunity: Rich in vitamins C and D, this combination boosts immune defenses.
  • Provides Warmth and Comfort: Dates offer an energy boost, while warm milk raises body temperature.
  • Supports Bone Health: Aids in maintaining strong bones and alleviating winter joint pain.
  • Improves Skin Health: Combats dryness and promotes hydration and youthfulness.
  • Boosts Energy Levels: Fuels the body and mind through natural sugars and balanced nutrition.
  • Enhances Sleep Quality: Aids sleep by improving melatonin production.
"Combining dates with warm milk can naturally boost your health during the cold winter months."

In conclusion, the age-old practice of consuming dates with warm milk offers numerous health benefits that help navigate the winter season, from improved immunity to better sleep quality.
newTitle: Health Benefits of Consuming Dates with Warm Milk in Winter

NASA’s InSight Mars lander: New HiRISE image reveals dusty resting place on the red planet - India TV News
summary:
NASA’s InSight Mars Lander Captured in New HiRISE Image Reveals Dusty Resting Place on the Red Planet

Publication Date: October 23, 2024 | Source: India TV News

The InSight Mars lander has been observed in a new image captured by the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter, showing it covered in Martian dust, highlighting dust movement and wind patterns on Mars.

  • The InSight lander landed on Mars in November 2018 and studied the planet's seismic activity and internal structure.
  • The mission officially ended in December 2022 due to dust accumulation on its solar panels.
  • NASA's monitoring operations are expected to conclude by the end of 2024.
  • The recent HiRISE image helps researchers understand the Martian dust cycle and wind dynamics.
  • Dust accumulation has altered surface features, including the fading of geological marks made by InSight's landing thrusters.
  • The Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter continues to provide crucial data for current and future Mars missions.
“The latest image of InSight may mark the lander’s silent legacy, but it continues to contribute to our understanding of the dusty mysteries of Mars.” - NASA

This observation not only preserves the legacy of the InSight lander but also plays a critical role in preparing for future exploration missions on Mars.
newTitle: NASA’s InSight Mars Lander Captured in New HiRISE Image Reveals Dusty Resting Place on the Red Planet

The legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has claimed that Rohit Sharma may resign as India's cricket captain following the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series in Australia if his performance does not improve.

  • Rohit Sharma has scored only 152 runs in his last 13 innings, averaging 11.83.
  • He has faced criticism for a lack of runs against Bangladesh and New Zealand.

  • Rohit's possible retirement from the format has been a topic of speculation among fans.

OnePlus is gearing up to unveil its highly anticipated flagship smartphone, the OnePlus 13, in January 2025. The global debut will coincide with its launch in India, bringing several upgrades over its predecessor. Here’s a closer look at the top five enhancements expected in the OnePlus 13.

  • Enhanced performance with cutting-edge chipset: The OnePlus 13 will be powered by the latest Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, promising a 40% increase in CPU performance.
  • Refined design and durability: Featuring a Vegan leather finish option alongside glass variants and rumored IP69 rating for water and dust resistance.

title: 12 ways how doing yoga in winter can improve your health - Health shots
summary:
12 Ways Yoga in Winter Can Improve Your Health

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Healthshots

This article discusses the various health benefits of practicing yoga during the winter months, addressing common ailments like stiffness, low energy, and joint pain.

  • Yoga helps keep your body warm by generating heat through movement and stretching.
  • Practicing yoga boosts immunity, helping to fend off winter illnesses like colds and flu.
  • Yoga enhances energy levels, combating seasonal lethargy and fatigue.
  • It improves cardiovascular health by reducing blood pressure and enhancing circulation.
  • Regular yoga practice combats stiffness, improving flexibility and range of motion.
  • Yoga relieves joint pain and reduces inflammation during cold weather.
  • Mindful breathing and meditation techniques in yoga help manage stress and improve mood.
  • Yoga strengthens lungs and enhances respiratory health.
  • It alleviates back pain and promotes better posture.
  • Yoga promotes a healthy sleep cycle, countering the effects of shorter days.
  • It aids in weight management by encouraging mindful eating habits.
  • Yoga improves digestion, reducing the risk of constipation common in winter.
“Practicing yoga helps improve blood circulation and release endorphins, which are natural mood and energy boosters.”

In conclusion, embracing yoga during winter not only combats seasonal challenges but also promotes overall physical and mental well-being.
newTitle: 12 Ways Yoga in Winter Can Improve Your Health

title: Ambuja Cements shares in focus as cement major merges subsidiaries, Sanghi and Penna Cement; check merger details - Upstox
summary:
Ambuja Cements Merges Subsidiaries Sanghi and Penna Cement

Publication Date: December 18, 2023 | Source: PTI

Ambuja Cements, India's second-largest cement maker owned by the Adani Group, is set to merge its subsidiaries Sanghi Industries and Penna Cement. This move is expected to streamline operations and enhance shareholder value.

  • Ambuja Cements announced the merger on December 18, 2023.
  • The merger is subject to necessary approvals and is expected to be completed in 9-12 months.
  • For every 100 shares of Sanghi Industries, shareholders will receive 12 shares of Ambuja Cements.
  • Shareholders of Penna Cement will receive ₹321.50 for each share they hold.
  • This merger aims to increase Ambuja's market competitiveness and efficiency.
  • The Adani Group aims for a cement capacity of 140 million tonnes by FY28.
“This merger aims to make our company more competitive and efficient, ultimately enhancing shareholder value.” - Ajay Kapur, CEO, Cement Business, Adani Group

This merger represents a significant step for Ambuja Cements in expanding its market share and operational efficiency within the competitive cement industry.
newTitle: Ambuja Cements Merges Subsidiaries Sanghi and Penna Cement

title: Pushpa 2 stampede: Hyderabad theatre gets show cause notice after woman's death - India Today
summary:
Hyderabad Theatre Issues Notice After Pushpa 2 Stampede Death

Published On: Dec 18, 2024

Source: India Today

Following a tragic stampede during the screening of Pushpa 2, Hyderabad police have issued a notice to Sandhya Theatre management over multiple management lapses that led to a woman's death.

  • The theatre management has been issued a show cause notice citing 11 lapses during the screening.
  • The management allegedly failed to inform local authorities about actor Allu Arjun's arrival prior to the incident.
  • Improper entry, exit, and seating arrangements were cited as significant failures.
  • Management encouraged crowding with unauthorized large advertisements outside the theatre.
  • Sufficient security measures were not in place, contributing to the chaos.
A 39-year-old woman named Revathi died during the stampede, while her son was critically injured.

The police warned that the theatre must respond within 10 days or they risk having their Cinematograph License revoked.
newTitle: Hyderabad Theatre Issues Notice After Pushpa 2 Stampede Death

title: Priyanka Gandhi on Yogi Adityanath's jibe at her Palestine bag: ‘Throwing youths into…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Yogi Adityanath's Comments on Her Palestine Bag

Publication Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has reacted to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's remarks regarding her bag featuring the term 'Palestine'. She criticized the state's policy of sending youths to Israel for work in conflict zones, calling it shameful.

  • Priyanka Gandhi carried a 'Palestine' bag to Parliament, which attracted criticism from BJP leaders.
  • Yogi Adityanath stated that over 5,600 youths from UP have gone to Israel for employment, emphasizing their safety and salaries.
  • Priyanka labeled sending youths into a war zone for jobs as a disgrace and highlighted the unemployment issues in UP.
  • She spoke out against the exploitation of these youths and their families, who live in constant fear.
"Throwing our youths into the war zone for employment is not something to pat on the back but a matter of shame." - Priyanka Gandhi

This exchange underscores ongoing tensions between political leaders regarding employment strategies and international relations.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Yogi Adityanath's Comments on Her Palestine Bag

title: China building villages near Doklam in Bhutan: Satellite data - Hindustan Times
summary:
China Building Villages Near Doklam in Bhutan: Satellite Data

Publication Date: December 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

In recent years, satellite imagery has revealed that China has constructed at least 22 villages and settlements within territory traditionally recognized as part of Bhutan, with significant developments near the strategically important Doklam plateau.

  • 22 villages identified in Bhutanese territory, with a focus on strategic locations near Doklam.
  • 8 of the villages were built since 2020, enhancing China's military foothold.
  • China has relocated approximately 7,000 people to these new settlements, consisting of 2,284 residential units.
  • The construction of these villages poses new risks to India's Siliguri Corridor.
  • Former Bhutanese Prime Minister claimed in 2023 that these facilities “are not in Bhutan”.
  • A report indicates that China has effectively annexed about 825 sq km of Bhutanese territory.
“This is all part of China’s characteristic of pursuing its claims while disregarding past commitments and the position of other countries.” - Ashok Kantha

In conclusion, the expansion of Chinese settlements poses challenges for Bhutan and neighboring India, reshaping the strategic dynamics of the region.
newTitle: China Constructing Villages Near Doklam in Bhutan: Satellite Analysis Reveals

Delhi AQI: Air quality at ‘severe-plus’ category in some areas amid GRAP curbs - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi AQI: Air quality at ‘severe-plus’ category in some areas amid GRAP curbs

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi faced dangerously high levels of air pollution with the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) reaching over 440, classifying the air quality as ‘severe’. The city implemented Stage 4 restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) to combat the pollution crisis.

  • Overall AQI recorded at 442 at 7 am on December 18, 2024.
  • Some monitoring stations reported AQI levels in the ‘severe-plus’ category beyond 450.
  • AQI levels at worst stations: Nehru Nagar (480), Alipur (471), Anand Vihar (481).
  • Stage 4 restrictions include a ban on construction activities and non-essential vehicle entry into Delhi.
  • Experts attribute rising pollution to low wind speeds and various local factors.
“Breathing Delhi's polluted air is equivalent to smoking approximately 10 cigarettes a day.”

The ongoing air quality crisis necessitates urgent action and compliance with GRAP restrictions to protect public health.
newTitle: Delhi Air Quality Reaches 'Severe-Plus' Levels Amid Pollution Restrictions

summary:
Shatrughan Sinha blasts Mukesh Khanna for jibe at Sonakshi Sinha's upbringing

Date: Dec 18, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Shatrughan Sinha has come to the defense of his daughter, Sonakshi Sinha, after actor Mukesh Khanna criticized her upbringing following her inability to answer a question about the Ramayana on a quiz show.

  • Mukesh Khanna criticized Sonakshi Sinha for not knowing a Ramayana answer on KBC.
  • Shatrughan Sinha questions Khanna's authority to comment on Hinduism.
  • Sonakshi's response highlighted the gender bias in Khanna's remarks.
  • Shatrughan expressed pride in Sonakshi's achievements and defended her character.
“Not answering a question on the Ramayana doesn’t disqualify Sonakshi from being a good Hindu. She doesn’t need a certificate of approval from anyone.” - Shatrughan Sinha

This public dispute highlights the ongoing conversation around celebrity culture, online scrutiny, and personal autonomy in the public eye.

title: Congress demands Amit Shah's apology for insulting Ambedkar - The Hindu
summary:
Congress Demands Amit Shah's Apology for Insulting Ambedkar

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Congress party has called for an apology from Home Minister Amit Shah for remarks made during a Rajya Sabha debate, accusing him of displaying hatred toward Dr. B.R. Ambedkar.

  • Shah's comments were seen as disrespectful, with Congress leaders asserting that they reflect a deeper disdain for Ambedkar.
  • Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi noted that followers of Manusmriti would naturally oppose Ambedkar's ideals.
  • Congress president Kharge emphasized the importance of Ambedkar as a revered figure among marginalized communities.
  • Critics from Congress highlighted the BJP's longstanding opposition to Ambedkar's contributions to Indian society.
  • Shah countered accusations by claiming Congress's history of appeasement and misuse of the Constitution.
"The BJP's disgust towards Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar was always well known, and the Home Minister's pathetic statements... confirm how much they hate and detest Dr. Ambedkar." - K.C. Venugopal

The criticisms from the Congress leaders point towards a broader discontent with the BJP's governance and its handling of historical figures like Ambedkar, which may impact political dynamics moving forward.
newTitle: Congress Demands Amit Shah's Apology for Insulting Ambedkar

‘Ready to work with India’, says China ahead of key Doval-Wang talks | What's on agenda - Hindustan Times
summary:
China Ready to Collaborate with India Before Key Doval-Wang Talks

Date: Dec 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

China is prepared to work with India to restore bilateral relations ahead of upcoming talks between India's National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, marking the first meeting of Special Representatives in five years.

  • First Doval-Wang meeting since December 2019 will take place in Beijing.
  • China's foreign ministry emphasizes readiness to strengthen mutual trust and settle differences.
  • The two leaders will discuss border management and explore solutions to the boundary dispute.
  • Recent agreements were reached regarding patrolling arrangements along the Line of Actual Control.
  • The military standoff, starting in May 2020, has strained India-China relations.
“China is ready to work with India to implement the important common understandings between our leaders... and bring bilateral relations back to the track of stable and healthy development as soon as possible.”

This structured dialogue represents a critical step in rebuilding relationships strained by previous military clashes and ongoing tensions along the Indo-China border.
newTitle: China Ready to Collaborate with India Before Key Doval-Wang Talks

summary:
Pushpa 2 The Rule Stampede: Show Cause Notice Issued to Sandhya Theatre for '11 Lapses' After Woman's Death at Premiere

Publication Date: December 12, 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Hyderabad police has issued a show cause notice to Sandhya Theatre for lapses leading to a woman's death during the premiere of Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2'.

  • The notice outlines 11 alleged lapses by the theatre management.
  • Management failed to inform police about Allu Arjun's arrival, leading to crowd mismanagement.
  • No proper guidance for entry and exit points, encouraging crowd gathering without permission.
  • Inadequate security arrangements resulted in the tragic incident.
  • A case registered against Allu Arjun and theatre management following a complaint from the deceased woman's family.
  • A medical update indicated the boy injured in the incident is in stable condition but still requires intensive care.
“The neurological condition is severely impacted. The doctors have opined that it will be a long haul before any improvements can be seen.”

The incident has raised significant concerns about safety protocols at major events, highlighting the need for strict adherence to crowd management practices.
newTitle: Hyderabad Theatre Issued Notice After Deadly Pushpa 2 Premiere Stampede

  • Authorities responded quickly to the 911 call, arriving within three minutes.
